news_header: Public anger in China over ineffective generic drugs has prompted a rare government response. Doctors criticize the drug procurement system for prioritizing cheap generics over safety, while officials claim concerns are based on perception. The controversy has intensified since a hospital director's viral video highlighted issues with generics.
news_original_title: 'Ineffective' generic drugs fuel rare public anger in China
news_text: Many patients report negative experiences, leading to distrust in generics. The procurement system, designed to reduce costs, has raised quality concerns as low bids may compromise drug efficacy. The healthcare system faces mounting pressure from an aging population and financial strains, with calls for improved quality control and drug standards.
